zone.line: with the greatest fluency of potassium &
Boron zinc bismuth- of sulphats and oxids
and displayed so many words terms to which
I could not affix anyno idea: that I was
disgusted with the appearance of a science
that appeared to me to contain only words.
From this time untill I went to
Colledge I entirely neglected my formerly
adored study of chemistrythe science of natural philosophy although I still
read with delight Pliny and Buffons
authors that stood about on a parar of
in my estimation of nearly equal interest & utility
My studies occupations at this age were th principally the
mathematics, which I delighted in an and most
of the branches of study appertaining th to that
science. I was also busily employed in learning
languages Latin was ^already familiar to me and I began to
read without the help of the dictionary lexicon some of the
easiest greek authors. I also understood English &
german perfectly. theseis are is list of my accom
plishments at that time the period the age of and you may
conceive that my hours were fully employd
in acquiring and maintaining a knowledge
of this various literature.
